Twitter: s exercise of free speech: Legal experts emphasized that Twitter's actions in responding to Trump's speech with their own, such as fact-checking and labeling, are within their First Amendment rights as a private platform.
First Amendment protections: Experts pointed out that the First Amendment's free speech protections only guard against government interference, and Twitter, as a private company, has the right to set its own terms and policies.
Counterspeech and information links: Instead of banning or removing Trump's posts, Twitter added links to more information, which experts argued is protected as counterspeech and does not infringe on free speech rights.
